ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fmt:
- '12.0'
libblas:
- 3.9.* *netlib
libboost_devel:
- '1.88'
libboost_headers:
- '1.88'
liblapack:
- 3.9.* *netlib
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

name: cantera-recipe

about.description: Cantera is an open-source suite of tools for problems involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport processes
about.summary: Chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport tool suite

about.description: Cantera is an open-source suite of tools for problems involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport processes

raw_meta_yaml:
# When this version is updated, make sure to update the CT_GIT_COMMIT variable in
# the build/script_env section.
{% set version = "3.2.0" %}

package:
  name: cantera-recipe
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  - url: https://github.com/Cantera/cantera/archive/v3.2.0.tar.gz
    sha256: f01e25e33f9d5e37db7ababe5af36b60caabff52dba04bb221d53e44735f60ec
  - url: https://github.com/Cantera/cantera-example-data/archive/v3.2.0.tar.gz
    sha256: 1b52e0d4e90c3b90213d71893167d13a27fec2790c9d79fbd6f3e71e0f778e4a
    folder: data/example_data

build:
  number: 0
  include_recipe: True
  script_env:
    - "CT_GIT_COMMIT=4a8358eb80cfeb50474386b5f9ec0b3a83519889"

# The requirements for Python and NumPy are mandatory in this section because that's
# how conda smithy rendering of this recipe produces one build configuration for each
# supported Python and NumPy version. There don't seem to be any overlinking warnings
# from this set of configuration. In addition, the build selector is required for the
# build/python dependency, even though we require that dependency regardless of whether
# we're cross-compiling
requirements:
  build:
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - scons >=4.1
    - packaging
    - doxygen
    - jinja2
    - typing_extensions  # [py < 311]
    - ruamel.yaml
  host:
    - python >=3.10
    - numpy
    - libboost-devel
    - fmt
    - eigen
    - yaml-cpp
    - sundials <8
    - hdf5 >=1.14
    - highfive >=2.7
    - pywin32  # [win]
    - openblas  # [win]
    - libblas * *openblas  # [win]
    - libblas  # [not win]
    - liblapack * *openblas  # [win]
    - liblapack  # [not win]
    - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
    - libgomp      # [linux]

outputs:
  - name: libcantera
    script: build_lib.sh  # [not win]
    script: build_lib.bat  # [win]
    build:
      ignore_run_exports:
        # only the header part of these libraries are used
        - libboost-headers
    requirements:
      build:
        - python
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - scons >=4.1
        - packaging
        - doxygen
        - jinja2
        - typing_extensions  # [py < 311]
        - ruamel.yaml
      host:
        - libboost-headers
        - fmt
        - eigen
        - yaml-cpp
        - sundials <8
        - hdf5 >=1.14
        - highfive >=2.7
        - pywin32  # [win]
        - openblas  # [win]
        - libblas * *openblas  # [win]
        - libblas  # [not win]
        - liblapack * *openblas  # [win]
        - liblapack  # [not win]
        - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
        - libgomp      # [linux]
      run:
        - hdf5 >=1.14
        - fmt
        - blas * *openblas  # [win]
    test:
      commands:
        - echo "STARTING TESTS"
        - cat ${CONDA_PREFIX}/conda-meta/libcantera-3.*.json  # [not win]
        - type %CONDA_PREFIX%\conda-meta\libcantera-3.*.json  # [win]
        - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libcantera${SHLIB_EXT}  # [not win]

  - name: libcantera-devel
    script: build_devel.sh  # [not win]
    script: build_devel.bat  # [win]
    build:
      ignore_run_exports:
        # only the header part of these libraries are used
        - libboost-headers
    requirements:
      build:
        - python
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - scons >=4.1
        - packaging
        - doxygen
        - jinja2
        - typing_extensions  # [py < 311]
        - ruamel.yaml
      host:
        - libboost-headers
        - fmt
        - eigen
        - yaml-cpp
        - sundials <8
        - pywin32  # [win]
        - {{ pin_subpackage('libcantera', exact=True) }}
        - openblas  # [win]
        - libblas * *openblas  # [win]
        - libblas  # [not win]
        - liblapack * *openblas  # [win]
        - liblapack  # [not win]
        - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
        - libgomp      # [linux]
      run:
        - eigen
        - fmt
        - {{ pin_subpackage('libcantera', exact=True) }}
    test:
      requires:
        - cmake
        - make  # [not win]
        - scons
        - pkgconfig
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - numpy
        - python
      files:
        - test-lib
      commands:
        - cat ${CONDA_PREFIX}/conda-meta/libcantera-devel-*.json  # [not win]
        - type %CONDA_PREFIX%\conda-meta\libcantera-devel-*.json  # [win]
        - test -f $PREFIX/include/cantera/transport.h  # [not win]
        - ./test-lib/test-samples.sh  # [not win and build_platform == target_platform]
        - call test-lib\test-samples.bat  # [win]

  - name: cantera
    script: build_py.sh  # [not win]
    script: build_py.bat  # [win]
    requirements:
      build:
        - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
        # These are needed to support cross-compiling. See
        # https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/knowledge_base/#details-about-cross-compiled-python-packages
        - numpy                                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cython                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - scons >=4.1
        - packaging
        - doxygen
      host:
        - python
        - pip
        - setuptools
        - packaging
        - libboost-headers
        - numpy
        - fmt
        - eigen
        - yaml-cpp
        - sundials <8
        - pywin32  # [win]
        - cython
        - jinja2
        - typing_extensions  # [py < 311]
        - ruamel.yaml
        # These two are added here so that conda-build doesn't package their files into cantera too
        - {{ pin_subpackage('libcantera-devel', exact=True) }}
        - {{ pin_subpackage('libcantera', exact=True) }}
        - openblas  # [win]
        - libblas * *openblas  # [win]
        - libblas  # [not win]
        - liblapack * *openblas  # [win]
        - liblapack  # [not win]
        - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
        - libgomp      # [linux]
      run:
        - python
        - ruamel.yaml
        - {{ pin_subpackage('libcantera', exact=True) }}
    build:
      ignore_run_exports:
        # only the header part of these libraries are used
        - libboost-headers
      entry_points:
        - ck2yaml = cantera.ck2yaml:main
        - cti2yaml = cantera.cti2yaml:main
        - ctml2yaml = cantera.ctml2yaml:main
        - yaml2ck = cantera.yaml2ck:main
      include_recipe: True
    test:
      requires:
        - pytest
        - pint
        - {{ pin_subpackage('libcantera-devel', exact=True) }}
        - cmake
        - make  # [not win]
        - scons
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
      imports:
        - cantera
      source_files:
        - test/python
        - test/data
        - data
      files:
        - test-lib
      commands:
        - cat ${CONDA_PREFIX}/conda-meta/cantera-*.json  # [not win]
        - type %CONDA_PREFIX%\conda-meta\cantera-*.json  # [win]
        - uname -a  # [not win]
        - python -c "import platform; print('Python platform:', platform.platform())"
        - python -m pytest -vv test/python  # [not ppc64le]
        # "test_fluxes" fails on ppc64le for unknown reasons
        - python -m pytest -vv test/python -k "not test_fluxes"  # [ppc64le]
        - cti2yaml --help
        - ck2yaml --help
        - ctml2yaml --help
        - yaml2ck --help
        - ./test-lib/test-extensiblerate.sh  # [not win and build_platform == target_platform and not (osx and x86_64 and (py == 310 or py == 312))]
        - call test-lib\test-extensiblerate.bat  # [win]

about:
  home: https://cantera.org
  summary: "Chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport tool suite"
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: License.txt
  dev_url: https://github.com/cantera/cantera
  description: Cantera is an open-source suite of tools for problems involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport processes
  doc_url: https://cantera.org/stable/python/index.html

extra:
  feedstock-name: cantera
  recipe-maintainers:
    - inducer
    - bryanwweber
    - matthiasdiener

about.description: Cantera is an open-source suite of tools for problems involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport processes
about.summary: Chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and transport tool suite
